intro: Rubus hemithyrsus, commonly known as the Mexican blackberry, is a species of bramble native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are dark purple to black in color, often covered in a whitish bloom. Its flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. The plant is valued for its edible fruits and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
